column4: I'm having a problem where linux won't boot if the IDE cable is plugged into my CD-ROM drive?  Is it common?
you probably have primary/secondary master/slave conflicts on the cable so it is not recognizing yoru harddrive
i have two hard drive and on a seperate cable i have the cd rom
when they are all plugged in does the bios recognize all the devices
grub probably needs the hda/hdb/hdc/hdd specification corrected.  when you plugin the cdrom it is probably changing the order of the drives
primary master should be hda, primary slave hdb, secondar master hdc, secondary slave hdd.  this has to be specific in grub and could be changing with the cdrom connected
not even the live cd will boot when the cd rom is plugged in
/bin/sh/:can't access tty job control turned off
